channel.title: Podcast on UN-aligned
channel.description: Recent content in Podcast on UN-aligned

item.title: Kazakhstan calls on Russia to help quell its unrest, Rock star Meat Loaf dies and Prince Andrew gets stripped (out of his royal patronage)
item.author: rubygoldenberg
item.description: From a messy closet to the freezing cold of Helsinki, hosts Ruby Goldenberg and Ariana Yekrangi show their commitment as they recap the events of January 2022 for the Gordian Monthly Recap.

item.title: French and UK authorities are being sued, Merkel retires and Honduras gets its first female leader
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: In this episode of Gordian Monthly Recap, Ruby Goldenberg and Ariana Yekrangi help you catch up with everything that happened in November 2021.

item.title: Here's everything you may have missed in November — The Gordian Monthly Recap
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: In this episode of Gordian Monthly Recap, Ruby and Ariana help you catch up with everything that happened in October 2021.

item.title: Here's everything you may have missed in October — The Gordian Monthly Recap
item.author: rubygoldenberg
item.description: In this episode of Gordian Monthly Recap, Ruby Goldenberg and Ariana Yekrangi help you catch up with everything that happened in October 2021.

item.title: What does Antonio Guterres' re-selection mean for the United Nations? — Podcast
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: While the UN's causes are noble, its communiques can feel like an alphabet soup and its members often behave like undisciplined children. An audio episode explores the ambitions and limitations of its leader, António Guterres

item.title: Are the ICJ and the ICC our answers to international justice? - Podcast
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: Humanity has created a biased, self-serving 'doppelgänger' of true justice through flawed laws, a concept explored here in relation to institutions like the International Court of Justice and the International Criminal Court.

item.title: Seven Ways to Create a Healthy Economy with Kate Raworth - Podcast
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: Economist Kate Raworth's 'Doughnut' model provides a visual framework for a healthy economy, outlining a safe and just space for humanity to thrive between its social and planetary boundaries.
